0.title: Elderly woman 'locked up' at home for 10 yrs by sons in TN, rescued
0.article_body: An elderly woman was rescued from her house in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur on Friday after her sons allegedly locked her there for 10 years. The district's Social Welfare Department rescued the woman after a video of her purportedly lying naked surfaced on social media. The sons, a retired policeman and a government employee, had made arrangements for food, police said.

1.title: Such a knock by an ex-player must hurt: Ojha on Tripathi's 71 vs KKR
1.article_body: Discussing SRH batter Rahul Tripathi's 71 off 37 balls in the win against KKR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said watching their former player perform like this must have hurt KKR. "KKR [may] be thinking that they made this player and gave him [an] opportunity," added Ojha. Tripathi's knock comprised four boundaries and six sixes.

2.title: Pollution in Yamuna impacted the water supply on Friday: Delhi Jal Board
2.article_body: A day after the ammonia concentration jumped to more than five times the treatable limit, pollution levels were brought under control in the Yamuna river and Delhi's regular water supply was restored on Friday evening. "The increased pollution resulted in operations being halved at the Wazirabad and Chandrawal treatment facilities on Friday (morning)," a Delhi Jal Board official said.

3.title: Struggling with my health, there are days when things get tough: SRH's Tripathi
3.article_body: Following his 37-ball 71 against KKR, SRH batter Rahul Tripathi said he was struggling with his health the last few days, adding that there are days when things get tough. "I am happy...I got this innings," added Tripathi who previously represented KKR. Tripathi has scored 171 runs in five IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 178.12.

4.title: 'Nude dance' organised at fair in Andhra Pradesh, police arrest 10 people
4.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Police have arrested ten people for organising 'nude dance' at a fair in Uppangala village. Police said that the incident took place on intervening night of April 14 and 15.  "A case has been registered and 10 people have been arrested," police said. Police added the people have been arrested based on a viral video.

5.title: Occupants 'luckily escape' after huge tree falls on 2 cars in Pune
5.article_body: Two cars and some two-wheelers were damaged after a huge Gulmohar tree fell on moving vehicles on Pune's Fergusson College Road on Friday, causing traffic congestion, officials said. "The occupants of two cars on whom the tree fell luckily escaped," a senior PMC fire officer said. The tree was cleared within 45 minutes, according to the fire brigade department.

6.title: Tiger offers his studio to 'India's Got Talent' contestants to practice stunts
6.article_body: Tiger Shroff offered Warrior Squad from 'India's Got Talent season 9' his own studio Fly Zone, where they can train for their stunts. According to Pinkvilla, he got so impressed by their performance that he decided to give them not only his studio but also his trainers. "What you have done for us...[is] very big," Warrior Squad's leader Rahul said.

7.title: Cooperating with insider trading probe: Call of Duty maker Activision
7.article_body: Call of Duty maker Activision Blizzard said it's cooperating with US government's investigations into trading by its CEO Bobby Kotick's friends right before the firm disclosed its sale to Microsoft, a filing showed. Barry Diller, David Geffen and investor Alexander von Furstenberg reportedly acquired share options after von Furstenberg met with Kotick days before the Microsoft sale was disclosed.

8.title: Woman searching for missing daughter raped by 3 waiters in Delhi
8.article_body: A 36-year old woman who was searching for her missing daughter was allegedly raped by three men working as waiters in West Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area, police said. The woman said that one of the men offered her help in finding her daughter but demanded that she accompany him and his two other friends to their rented accommodation.

9.title: Shut down your loudspeaker: MNS to Raut on comparing Raj Thackeray with Owaisi
9.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has put up posters outside Shiv Sena's Saamana newspaper office which read, "Whom did you call Owaisi? Sanjay Raut shut down your loudspeaker." This comes after Sanjay Raut said that BJP was using Raj Thackeray in Maharashtra similar to how it had used AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi in Uttar Pradesh during assembly elections.

10.title: Will never allow religious conversions but people need to be vigilant: Goa CM
10.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Friday said that the government will never allow religious conversions but people need to be vigilant. "The temple trusts in villages need to be vigilant, families need to be vigilant," he added. "Taking advantage of different things- someone is poor...somebody is backward...such people are being taken (in) in this manner," Sawant further said.

11.title: Went on 'Sanju' set 2-3 times, felt weird seeing myself in front of me: Sanjay
11.article_body: While talking about actor Ranbir Kapoor playing his role in 'Sanju', actor Sanjay Dutt said he went to set two-three times and that he felt weird seeing himself in front of him. "To see him being Sanjay Dutt and playing Sanju was amazing. It was fun," he added. He also said he would like to work with Salman Khan again.

12.title: Musk considering bringing in partners on his Twitter takeover offer: Report
12.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is speaking to investors who could partner with him on his Twitter acquisition offer, a report said. It said that Musk might be partnering with Silver Lake Partners, a private equity firm that was a potential investor when he considered taking Tesla private in 2018. Silver Lake's Co-CEO Egon Durban is already a Twitter board member.

13.title: Google, Wikipedia face fines over 'fake' content in Russia: Report
13.article_body: A Russian court has threatened Google and Wikimedia Foundation with fines for failing to delete "fake" information about the Ukraine conflict, Interfax reported. Earlier, Russian regulator Roskomnadzor urged Google to stop spreading "anti-Russian" content on YouTube. Russia had also blocked Instagram after Meta allowed Ukrainian users to post  messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

14.title: BJP felicitating those who launched a 'murderous attack' on CM: AAP
14.article_body: Criticising BJP for felicitating the eight accused who were arrested for vandalising Arvind Kejriwal's official residence, AAP's Manish Sisodia said BJP was felicitating those who launched a "murderous attack on the CM's house". "This proves that the BJP not only enlists goons but also promotes goondaism and rowdyism," Sisodia added. The eight BJYM members got bail from the High Court.

15.title: Punjab minister carries out surprise check of buses; 10 impounded
15.article_body: Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar carried out surprise checks on buses in Jalandhar and Zirakpur on Thursday and Friday. As many as 10 buses were impounded during the checks and fines worth a total of ₹3.9 lakh were imposed. Bhullar also strictly instructed officials to take action against buses that are evading tax and being run without proper documentation.

16.title: UP to organise global investors' summit for ₹10 lakh crore investment
16.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath asked officials on Friday to organise a global investors' summit within next two years to attract an investment of about ₹10 lakh crore. UP had reportedly received ₹4.68 lakh crore of investment proposals during the last investors' summit in 2018. "Out of these, proposals of over ₹3 lakh crore are being realised on...ground," he added.

17.title: Delhi schools free to decide on partial or full closure if cases rise: Sisodia
17.article_body: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister and Education Minister, Manish Sisodia, said schools in the national capital have the liberty to decide on partial or full closure if COVID-19 cases rise. "If any student...or...a teacher in a particular wing test positive, the wing or class should be temporarily closed," Sisodia said. "We haven't said the entire school should be closed," he added.

18.title: Overwhelmed: Kartik as fans in theatres cheer at his entry in 'Bhool...' teaser
18.article_body: The teaser of Kartik Aaryan's upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' was played in multiple theatres across the country. The actor took to Instagram on Friday to share some videos where his fans can be seen cheering and hooting at his entry in the teaser of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "Truly overwhelmed by the response #CinemasAreBack," Kartik captioned the post.

19.title: TV presenter and 'Gol Maal' actress Manju Singh passes away due to cardiac arrest
19.article_body: TV presenter and actress Manju Singh, who had featured in 1979 film 'Gol Maal' passed away due to cardiac arrest. Manju was also a producer and she had produced shows like 'Swaraj', 'Ek Kahani' and 'Show Time', among others. She was the anchor of the children's show 'Khel Khilone', which ran for seven years.

20.title: Some people take pictures with me first, later ask 'Are you an actor?': Rubina
20.article_body: Television actress Rubina Dilaik took to her Instagram Stories to say that some people first take pictures with her and later ask her which serial she works in. "And the best is 'Aap actor ho' [Are you an actor?]. I often get confused. Is it compliment or insult," Rubina added. Last year, she had reportedly called out her 'pseudo fans'.

21.title: Thousands rally in Serbia in support of Russia & against NATO
21.article_body: Thousands of Serbians marched through Belgrade to Russian Embassy to protest the government's bid to distance itself from Moscow after Ukraine invasion. Protesters were seen carrying Russian President Vladimir Putin's pictures, waving Russian and Serbian flags and chanting "No NATO", "Serbians and Russians are brothers". Serbia hasn't imposed sanctions on Russia but has voted against it in the UN.

22.title: ₹6.31-crore cash found hidden in beds of gutkha trader in UP, pics of raid surface
22.article_body: A Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) department team seized ₹6.31 crore in cash from beds of a gutkha trader in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. The team conducted raids at the gutkha trader's house and factory on Tuesday. The team got three note-counting machines from the SBI after finding the large amount of cash at the site.

23.title: 'Akhand Bharat' only when people from all castes live with unity: Gehlot to Bhagwat
23.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's "India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years" remark, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "Akhand Bharat will be made when each person from all castes starts living with brotherhood and love." He further said that BJP and RSS are using names of Sardar Patel, BR Ambedkar and Mahatma Gandhi just for their political benefits.

24.title: Bag with evidence in a case against Andhra minister stolen from court
24.article_body: A bag containing evidence against Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy in a forgery and defamation case was stolen from the fourth additional judicial magistrate's court in Nellore, police said. Govardhan in 2016 had accused then TDP minister Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy of amassing assets worth ₹1,000 crore, including properties in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand.

25.title: Philips and Virat Kohli talk about being #TenOnTenYou
25.article_body: Philips, along with Virat Kohli, has sparked a conversation about how the youth in India are constantly being judged by society. With this campaign, they aim to inspire the youth to ignore judgment and shape their true self, resonating with the Philips BT3000 beard Trimmer with Power Adapt Sensor, that adapts to the user’s unique style.

26.title: Mysterious liver disease detected in kids aged 1-6 in US, Europe; symptoms listed
26.article_body: A mysterious liver disease has been detected in kids aged 1-6 in US and Europe. This illness attacking only children has been brought to the notice of the World Health Organisation early this month, news agency AP reported. Symptoms of the disease include, jaundice, diarrhoea and abdominal pain. The disease has been so far reported to be severe.

27.title: Pune Metro footfall remains below 5,000 on weekdays in April: Report
27.article_body: The Pune Metro's ridership has reportedly dropped this month with figures not even crossing the 5,000-mark on weekdays falling between April 6 and 15. On March 6, the number of total riders was 37,752, which came down to 5,122 on April 6. However, the officials believe that numbers will increase once the total number of routes is increased.

28.title: Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law laundered ₹29.62 cr: Kirit Somaiya
28.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law Shridhar Patankar has laundered ₹29.62 crore through a company, BJP leader and former MP Kirit Somaiya said. "The company has constructed a building at Dadar's Shivaji Park...all the black money related to Thackeray's family has been parked in the company," he added. "CM should reply to these new facts that have emerged," Somaiya further said.

29.title: Alia Bhatt dances to 'Radha' with Karan Johar at her wedding after-party, video surfaces
29.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Alia Bhatt dancing to song 'Radha' from 2012 film 'Student of the Year' with filmmaker Karan Johar at her wedding after-party. Notably, Alia had made her acting debut in Bollywood with 'Student of the Year', which was co-produced by Johar's Dharma Productions. Alia got married to Ranbir Kapoor on April 14.

30.title: What is the 'poison pill' strategy adopted by Twitter against Musk's takeover offer?
30.article_body: Formally known as the shareholder rights plan, it's a defensive strategy used by companies against hostile takeovers. At Twitter, the plan will be triggered if any entity buys at least 15% of its stock in a purchase that isn't approved by its board. Following this, the entity's stake will be diluted as other shareholders will be offered discounted shares.

31.title: It's based on mythology of Vikram & Betal: Producer Neeraj on Vikram Vedha
31.article_body: Neeraj Pandey, who's backing Saif Ali Khan and Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha', has said the upcoming film is based on the mythology of Vikram and Betal. "The film is a contemporary take. We were surprised how come...North Indian film has not taken it up," he added. The film is a remake of Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi's Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha'.

32.title: Mob burns Muslim man's houses in UP after he elopes with Hindu girl
32.article_body: At least eight people were arrested on Friday after a mob allegedly set fire to two houses belonging to a Muslim man in Uttar Pradesh's Agra who had eloped with a Hindu girl. The 22-year-old girl claimed that she went with the man willingly. The mob, which included right-wing group members, accused the man of kidnapping the girl, police said.

33.title: Burglars break into house, steal ₹5 lakh in Ludhiana
33.article_body: Burglars broke into the house of Sumit Gupta, a cosmetic products trader in Ludhiana's Guru Nanak Pura and stole around ₹5 lakh on Tuesday. They also stole a wallet from his brother's car with ₹4,000 cash in it, Gupta said. As no cameras were installed outside the house, police are scanning the CCTVs in the area to trace the accused.

34.title: Twitter brings on JPMorgan as adviser amid Musk's acquisition offer: Report
34.article_body: Twitter has reportedly brought on JPMorgan Chase & Co. to help it respond to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion acquisition offer. As per a report, the bank recently started working to assist Twitter in talks with potential buyers. Meanwhile, Twitter has adopted a 'poison pill' strategy that prevents Musk from raising his stake in the company.

35.title: Will do everything to bring Uniform Civil Code: Shivpal Yadav
35.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia (PSPL) leader Shivpal Singh Yadav demanded the implementation of Uniform Civil Code and said, "We will do everything, even protest if needed, to fulfil the dream of Lohia and Ambedkar." "Ambedkar raised the issue of Uniform Civil Code in Constituent Assembly. Lohia had raised the issue too in Parliament. So we are supporting it," he added.

36.title: Actress Mohena, member of Rewa's erstwhile royal family, blessed with a baby boy
36.article_body: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh, who starred in the TV show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', and her husband Suyesh Rawat have been blessed with a baby boy. Mohena, who is a member of Rewa's erstwhile royal family, married politician and businessman Suyesh in October 2019. Mohena had also featured in 'Dance India Dance'.

37.title: Many buyers have agreed to pay in rubles for gas: Russia Deputy PM
37.article_body: Russia's Deputy PM Alexander Novak said that several buyers of Russian gas have agreed to switch to payments in rubles. "We expect the decision [to switch to rubles] from other importers," he added. Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles after the West imposed severe sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine invasion.

38.title: Pic of Russian woman who told soldier husband to 'rape Ukrainian women' released
38.article_body: The identities of a Russian soldier and his wife who discussed the rape of Ukrainian women in an intercepted phone call have been revealed following an investigation by Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty. The woman named Olga Bykovskaya told Roman Bykovsky to rape Ukrainian women amid the war, saying, "Don't tell me anything, understand...Just use protection."

39.title: 72-ft wide 'Glory Hole' opens up on US lake to drain excess water, pics surface
39.article_body: A gigantic 72-feet wide hole known as 'Glory Hole' has yet again opened up after the water level exceeded in the Lake Berryessa reservoir in the US. Built in the 1950s, 'Glory Hole' is a 75-metre-long tunnel that functions as a drain hole to swallow excess water. The hole appears to have a spinning vortex effect on the lake's surface.

40.title: Ranbir Kapoor hugs father-in-law Mahesh Bhatt on wedding day; pics surface
40.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt took to Instagram to share pictures of actor Ranbir Kapoor hugging filmmaker and father-in-law Mahesh Bhatt. "Who needs words when one has the ability to listen & speak from the heart?" she captioned the pictures. Pooja had earlier shared several pictures from the wedding, including that of the couple.

41.title: It lays bare Meta's hypocrisy: Apple on Meta's 47.5% metaverse tax
41.article_body: Apple has called out Meta's "hypocrisy" over its announcement to take a 47.5% cut from some developers selling digital goods on its metaverse platform, Horizon Worlds. It "lays bare Meta's hypocrisy", Apple said. "It goes to show that while they seek to use Apple's platform for free, they happily take from...creators and small businesses," an Apple spokesperson said.

42.title: Punjab man gets ₹5.62 lakh power bill for March, official says 'will check'
42.article_body: ID Singla of Punjab's Naya Gaon has received ₹5.62 lakh power bill for March. He said on an average, he pays around ₹5,000 to ₹6,000 a month for electricity. "I've been trying to contact PSPCL officials...but they are not responding," Singla said. Meanwhile, a PSPCL official said that the issue will be checked and sorted if any discrepancy is found.

43.title: Muslims are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate: Khurshid
43.article_body: Amid the Madhya Pradesh government's decision to bulldoze the houses of the accused in the Khargone violence, Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that Muslims "are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate". "When the State chooses to bypass the rule of law and destroy homes and lives, what respect is left for patriotism?" Khurshid asked.

44.title: Supreme Court grants bail to accused suffering from HIV
44.article_body: Supreme Court granted bail to a man, accused in several criminal cases, after noting that he is suffering from HIV and appears to be immunocompromised. The patient has severe dyspnoea at rest and is unable to walk without support, the medical report stated. The petitioner is at liberty to claim anonymisation of the records to suppress his identity, SC stated.

45.title: Bodies of 900 people found in Ukraine's Kyiv
45.article_body: The bodies of more than 900 civilians have been discovered in the region surrounding the Ukrainian capital Kyiv following Russia's withdrawal, most of them fatally shot, police said on Friday. "Consequently, we understand that under the occupation, people were simply executed in the streets," police added. More bodies are being found every day, police further said.

46.title: India reports 975 COVID-19 cases, 796 recoveries in last 24 hours
46.article_body: India has reported 975 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,366, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,747. The country saw 796 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

47.title: Union Min Meghwal narrowly escapes as iron mast falls on stage in UP
47.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal on Friday narrowly escaped after an iron mast with light fixtures fell on the stage due to strong winds during an extended Ambedkar Jayanti function in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. One person was killed and four were injured in the incident, ADM City said. The power supply to the area was also cut for some time.

48.title: Major fire breaks out at hosiery unit in Ludhiana, short circuit suspected
48.article_body: A major fire broke out at a hosiery unit near Ludhiana's Saidan Chowk at 10:30 am on Friday. "I suspect the fire broke out due to a short-circuit...the flames had engulfed the second and third floors of the building," the owner of Maharaja Collections, where the fire broke out, said. He added he suffered a loss of around ₹1.5 crore.

49.title: Children have right to love & affection of separated parents: Bombay HC
49.article_body: While hearing the petition of a 38-year-old father seeking temporary custody of his twin sons, the Bombay High Court said, "Children have the right to love and affection of both parents and grandparents." The petitioner who was granted four-day custody of his children told that his divorced wife did not allow him to meet his sons for nearly 22 months.

50.title: Ishq Vishk changed my life forever but I can't relate to 23-yr-old self: Shahid
50.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor who worked in his first Bollywood film 'Ishq Vishk' at age of 23, says that film changed his life forever. The actor, however, added he has changed tremendously and he can't even relate to his 23 year old self. "I don't know why...[I can't relate to...those years]...because beauty of life is to keep evolving...and changing," he added.

51.title: 22 held for cheating job seekers of over ₹1.25 cr in 6 months in Gurugram
51.article_body: As many as 22 people, including nine women, were arrested for running a fake call centre involved in cheating job seekers of over ₹1.25 crore in six months, Gurugram Police said. Police seized 21 computers, 27 mobile phones, one laptop and ₹38,000 in cash from the call centre. The accused used to run a fake website called placement.com, police added.

52.title: Drunk man fires 5 rounds at wife, children in Thane; detained
52.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Thane was detained by police on Friday for firing five rounds at his own wife and sons. According to police, Rajesh Sharma had returned home in a drunken state. He reportedly had an argument with his family members following which he opened fire from his licensed revolver. None of the family members was injured, police added.

53.title: Imran Khan seeks donation from overseas Pakistanis to topple new govt
53.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Friday appealed to overseas Pakistanis to donate money to his Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party to topple the "foreign-backed" government of PM Shehbaz Sharif and hold new elections. Khan blamed the US for overthrowing his government and said he wanted the country to hold fresh elections where Pakistani citizens could decide on their future.

54.title: Utterly indefensible to not put this offer to vote: Musk on his Twitter bid
54.article_body: Replying to a user on Twitter possibly rejecting his offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It would be utterly indefensible not to put this offer to a shareholder vote. They own the company, not the board of directors." The user had tweeted, "If the board of directors...reject the offer...wouldn't it be acting in...opposition to the financial interests of their shareholders?"

55.title: 'Mark Zuckerberg the 14th' will continue controlling Facebook: Musk
55.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk while discussing media ownership at TED conference commented on Mark Zuckerberg's share ownership at Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, saying that even "Mark Zuckerberg the 14th" will "literally" be controlling the entities. Musk, who has made a $43 billion bid for Twitter, added, "We won't have that at Twitter."

56.title: K'taka govt is going after religious minorities: B'luru Archbishop
56.article_body: Bengaluru Archbishop Peter Machado told The Quint on Friday that the Karnataka government seems to "have an agenda and is going after the religious minorities". "First they went after Christians, and now they're going after...Muslims," he added. Furthermore, he also said that a meat ban on specific days is like "boycotting Christmas cakes because they're considered a Christian delicacy".

57.title: Kapoors, Bhatts told Panditji what to do, dad became director at wedding: Rahul
57.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt said that the senior members of the Kapoor and Bhatt families were telling the pandit performing Alia and Ranbir's wedding rituals what to do. "After all it's a film family...like my dad he suddenly became a film director there as if he is directing a film," Rahul added.

58.title: Dale Steyn's reaction to Umran Malik's wicket-taking yorker goes viral
58.article_body: SRH fast bowling coach Dale Steyn's reaction to fast bowler Umran Malik taking KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket with a yorker has gone viral. Steyn jumped out of his seat and celebrated the wicket with SRH spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan. Steyn later revealed that Muralitharan had predicted that Umran would bowl a yorker to Iyer on that delivery.

59.title: 4 men follow steel trader for 282 kms to Mumbai, loot ₹15 lakh cash
59.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested four men from Nashik for allegedly following a 26-year-old steel and metal trader for 282 kilometres on their bike, from Malegaon to Mumbai, and robbing him of ₹15 lakh cash at knifepoint in Parel. The four robbers were tracking the Malegaon-based trader Shahrukh Khan's movement and figured out that he carried cash to Mumbai every Sunday.

60.title: Fashion influencer who started Rihanna-A$AP Rocky cheating rumour apologises
60.article_body: Fashion influencer Louis Pisano has issued an apology after tweeting that Rihanna and A$AP Rocky had broken up after the rapper was "caught cheating" on the singer with shoe designer Amina Muaddi. "Last night I made a dumb decision to tweet some information I had received," Pisano wrote. "I apologise to them for this unnecessary drama," Pisano added.

61.title: VJ-actor Cyrus Sahukar marries longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara, pic surfaces
61.article_body: VJ, host and actor Cyrus Sahukar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara on Friday. The wedding, that took place in Alibaug, was attended by Shruti Seth, Mini Mathur, Kabir Khan, Sahil Sangha and Devraj Sanyal, among others. Cyrus and Vaishali started dating each other over six years ago.

62.title: US-based Thoma Bravo contacts Twitter with acquisition offer: Report
62.article_body: US-based private equity firm Thoma Bravo has contacted Twitter and is putting together an acquisition offer that could rival Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid, as per a report. While it isn't yet clear as to how much Thoma Bravo will offer, a source said that the company could be a white knight for Twitter and CEO Parag Agrawal.

63.title: Mumbai's TIFR asks staff not to post anti-govt content on social media
63.article_body: Mumbai's Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) has instructed its staff and their family members not to post any anti-government content on social media. The institute has also asked employees to refrain from posting pictures and videos of institute facilities on social media platforms like Facebook and WhatsApp. It added that such activities could lead to "serious security consequences".

64.title: Man kidnaps wife on suspicion of her character in Pune; 3 arrested
64.article_body: Pune police have arrested a man and his two associates for allegedly kidnapping his wife, as he suspected her character and wanted to murder her. The woman raised an alarm and threw her phone when the accused forcefully put her in a car, following which a passer-by informed police. Police learnt that the accused were in Phaltan and caught them.

65.title: Hyd Police share pic of congested road, urge public to follow traffic rules
65.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police took to Twitter to share a picture of a congested road with several vehicles standing haphazardly. "Follow traffic rules! Breaking traffic rules causes inconvenience to you and others too," police wrote on Twitter. A Twitter user, in the comments section, asked if 3 days imprisonment can be given to those who drive on wrong side.

66.title: Punjab announces 300 units of free power for households from July 1
66.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in Punjab has announced 300 units of free power for households from July 1. This comes after Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of Punjab. Providing free electricity to every household for up to 300 units was one of the poll promises made by AAP.

67.title: Woman murders 3-month-old daughter after fight with husband in Delhi
67.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly strangled her three-month-old daughter to death after a fight with her husband at their residence in Delhi's Haiderpur area, police said. "She had a quarrel with her husband...over some domestic issue. When he left for work, she killed the baby in a fit of rage by pulling the thread worn around her neck," police added.

68.title: Man gets messages to pay off loan he didn't take, asks Hyd Police for help
68.article_body: A Twitter user shared screenshots of WhatsApp chats, claiming that he has been getting messages from "loan apps" to pay off the loan that he claimed he did not take from them. While tagging the Hyderabad Police in his tweet, he wrote, "Please help me sir. I'm getting these messages daily." Hyderabad Police asked him to approach nearest police station.

69.title: Woman dies after stray bull attacks her with its horns in Noida
69.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died after being attacked by a stray bull outside her house in Noida's Phase 1 on Friday morning. The woman was walking towards a shop to buy food for her children when the bull charged at her and attacked her with its horns, police said. The bull reportedly attacked her again when she fell down on road.

70.title: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
70.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.

71.title: 11 persons were drunk during protest at Pawar's house: Mumbai Police
71.article_body: Mumbai Police said on Friday that 11 people, who participated in the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house last week in Mumbai, were drunk. The police had taken the samples of 81 people. Police added that on April 7, a meeting was held at advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte's house and 20-25 people participated in it.

72.title: Rahul Tripathi slams 71(37) as SRH defeat KKR to register their 3rd win in a row
72.article_body: SRH defeated KKR by seven wickets to register their third consecutive victory in IPL 2022 and move to the seventh position on the points table. KKR, who have now lost two matches in a row, dropped to the fourth position. Rahul Tripathi's 71(37) and Aiden Markram's 68(36) helped SRH chase down 176-run target in 17.5 overs.

73.title: Sorry guys, really wanted to play: Deepak Chahar after being ruled out of IPL 2022
73.article_body: After being ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a back injury, CSK fast bowler Deepak Chahar took to Instagram to pen a note. He wrote, "Sorry guys...Really wanted to play but will come back better and stronger like I have always done. Thanks for always supporting me with your love and wishes. Need your blessings."

74.title: Robot that can be controlled remotely to treat stroke patients made by MIT
74.article_body: Engineers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a telerobotic system that can help doctors remotely treat patients experiencing a stroke or aneurysm using a modified joystick. The robotic arm has a magnet attached to its wrist and its orientation can be adjusted to guide a magnetic wire through the patient's arteries and vessels to remove blood clots.

75.title: China's Xi'an imposes partial lockdown to fight COVID outbreak
75.article_body: The local government in China's Xi'an city on Friday said that it will impose a partial lockdown from April 16 to April 19 after reporting dozens of COVID-19 infections this month. The announcement comes as a surge in coronavirus cases continues in other parts of the country. Residents should largely keep their movements within residential compounds, the government added.

76.title: From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride: Alia's bodyguard on her wedding
76.article_body: Alia Bhatt's bodyguard Sunil Talekar posted a photo of himself with the actress and actor Ranbir Kapoor after their wedding ceremony. "From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride I can say my heart is filled with happiness today," he wrote in the caption. "Cutest caption ever," an Instagram user commented.

77.title: If I was an Indian selector, I'd keep close eye on SRH's Natarajan: Vaughan
77.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said if he was an Indian selector then he'd be keeping a close eye on SRH pacer T Natarajan. "Looking at India, I think they'd be silly not to look at him," he added. Natarajan, who last played for India over a year ago, has taken 11 wickets from five matches in IPL 2022 so far.

78.title: Russia expels 18 European Union diplomats from Moscow
78.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Friday expelled 18 European Union diplomats from the country. Notably, the move comes after 19 Russian diplomats were ordered to leave the EU on April 5. "The EU is responsible for the consistent destruction of the architecture of bilateral dialogue and cooperation that had taken decades to form," the ministry said in a statement.

79.title: Video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' goes viral
79.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' has gone viral. After finishing his speech at the North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State University, Biden turned and appeared to shake hands with 'thin air'. He looked apparently lost for a moment before walking off the stage. Some social media users said that his actions were being misinterpreted.

80.title: Situation of hosting Asia Cup in SL to be assessed on final day of IPL: Shah
80.article_body: Asian Cricket Council President and BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said situation of hosting Asia Cup 2022 in Sri Lanka will be assessed on final day of ongoing IPL. Sri Lanka is battling a severe economic crisis with food and fuel scarcity affecting the population. Asia Cup is scheduled to be hosted in Sri Lanka from August 27 to September 11.

81.title: WhatsApp emoji reactions soon to make their debut
81.article_body: Emoji reactions will be among the latest upcoming features on WhatsApp, as has been confirmed by Will Cathcart, Head of WhatsApp, in a tweet. He also announced the launch of several other features such as communities, larger file sharing, up to 32 participants on audio calls and greater admin control. The emoji reactions are also features of Instagram and Telegram.

82.title: Met Congress rebel MLAs, formed 'Team Sidhu': Navjot Singh Sidhu
82.article_body: After reports claimed that rebel Congress MLAs were planning to leave the party, former Punjab Congress President Navjot Singh Sidhu said that he held a meeting with rebel MLAs where 'Team Sidhu' was formed. 'Team Sidhu' will look into the problems raised by party MLAs, Sidhu said. "I will continue to fight for the interests of Punjab," he added.

83.title: 46-yr-old man beaten to death over monetary dispute in Jharkhand
83.article_body: Police investigating the death of a 46-year-old man, whose body was found at a dhaba near NH98 in Jharkhand's Palamu on Wednesday, believe he was beaten with a stick. The deceased, Pappu Shondik, had reportedly lent ₹10 lakh to dhaba owner who gave him two cheques in return. However, after the cheques bounced, Pappu pressured him to return the money.

84.title: Young women put sexualised images, but it's not their fault: Sonam
84.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has stated that she sees a lot of her young colleagues who are catering to an audience by putting out highly sexualised imagery, adding that it's not their fault. "If I put a sexy photo of myself on Instagram, it's got like 10 times more likes than a picture of me in a pretty dress," Sonam said.

85.title: SBI to hire business consultant for prospects in EV space
85.article_body: India's largest public sector lender SBI has decided to hire a consultant to explore business opportunities for digital payments in the electric vehicle (EV) charging segment. The consultant will need to identify market potential, develop a strategic roadmap and provide recommendations on the next steps and areas for support through investments, said SBI in a request for proposal (RFP) document.

86.title: Twitter adopts 'poison pill' rights plan to block Musk's $43 billion takeover bid
86.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

87.title: ₹1.90 cr unaccounted cash seized from 2 bus passengers in Andhra
87.article_body: Police in Andhra Pradesh on Friday recovered unaccounted cash worth ₹1.90 crore from two passengers travelling on a bus during a routine check. The accused have been arrested, police said. "The two could not produce any documentation for [the cash], therefore it was declared unaccountable cash and will be handed over to the Income Tax department," police added.

88.title: B'deshi teenager arrested for sneaking into India to buy chocolate
88.article_body: A Bangladeshi teenager was arrested for illegally crossing into India to buy chocolate from Sipahijala in Tripura, BSF officials said. Eman Hossain hails from a village next to a river that marks the international border between India and Bangladesh. He used to sneak through a hole in the barbed wire fencing to buy chocolate, but was caught on April 13.

89.title: 150 Palestinians injured in clashes with Israeli police in Jerusalem
89.article_body: More than 150 Palestinians were wounded in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday. Most of the injuries were incurred by rubber bullets, stun grenades and beatings with batons, the Palestine Red Crescent Society said. The Israeli police claimed that the clashes began after the Palestinians began hurling stones and firecrackers at security forces.

90.title: Death toll from floods in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal rises to 395
90.article_body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal Province rose to 395 on Friday. The floods have knocked out power lines, shut down water services and disrupted operations at port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports. Earlier, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa had visited the flood-hit parts of the province and promised to provide support to affected communities.

91.title: Bihar CM opens ₹550-crore soft drink bottling plant at Begusarai
91.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday opened a soft drink bottling plant, which is said to be worth ₹550 crore, at Asurari in Begusarai. State Industries Minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said the Pepsi bottling plant of Varun Beverages Limited would generate employment and give preference to locals. He further announced that 17 ethanol units would be opened soon in Bihar.

92.title: Man dies by suicide in Telangana hospital after son denied job
92.article_body: A 46-year-old man, who was undergoing treatment at a Telangana hospital, allegedly died after consuming pesticide on Thursday. He reportedly did so as his family was unable to pay hospital bills of ₹60,000 after his son was denied a job. The deceased's son had earlier been promised a job by authorities while acquiring his land for Kakatiya Thermal Power Project.

93.title: Sri Lanka starts rationing fuel amid severe economic crisis
93.article_body: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced it would ration fuel to the public from Friday, amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Buses, lorries and commercial vehicles have been exempted from the measure. Earlier this week, Sri Lanka had declared that it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.

94.title: PM Modi to unveil 108 ft Lord Hanuman statue in Gujarat tomorrow
94.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet statue of Lord Hanuman on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti in Gujarat's Morbi on Saturday. "This is the second of the four statues being set up in the four directions across India, as part of the #Hanumanji4dham project," informed the Prime Minister's Office. The first statue was set up in Shimla.

95.title: Twitter adopts shareholder rights plan after Musk offers to buy it for $43 billion
95.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

96.title: Russian Defence Minister suffers heart attack, says businessman
96.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has suffered a massive heart attack that may not have occurred from natural causes, exiled Russian businessman Leonid Nevzlin has alleged. Nevzlin also said that Shoigu is "out of the game" and could be left disabled if he survives and is currently in intensive care. He added that 20 generals have been arrested amid war.

97.title: Shaheen shares pics from Alia-Ranbir wedding, says 'Our weird tribe got weirder'
97.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt on Friday took to Instagram to share pictures from Alia's wedding with Ranbir. She wrote, "My two favourite people in the world got married yesterday and our weird, happy little tribe just got a whole lot weirder and happier." The couple got married in an intimate ceremony on April 14 at Ranbir's Vastu residence.

98.title: Soni Razdan gifts son-in-law Ranbir watch worth ₹2.5 crore: Report
98.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan gifted her son-in-law actor Ranbir Kapoor a watch worth ₹2.5 crore at Alia and Ranbir's wedding on Thursday, reported Hindustan Times. It is reportedly a high-end watch which is from a brand that is not easily available. The wedding guests received Kashmiri shawls as a gift which were picked by Alia, the report added.

99.title: Burnley sack manager Sean Dyche amid PL relegation battle
99.article_body: Burnley on Friday announced they have parted company with manager Sean Dyche as the club struggles to avoid relegation from the Premier League this season. Dyche, 50, was the longest serving manager in the Premier League having been in charge of Burnley for nine-and-a-half seasons. Burnley are currently 18th on the Premier League table with 24 points.

100.title: West Ham Utd beat Lyon 3-0 to reach UEFA Europa League semi-finals
100.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat French side Olympique Lyonnais 3-0 to win their quarter-final tie 4-1 on aggregate to reach the semi-finals of the UEFA Europa League. Craig Dawson, Declan Rice and Jarrod Bowen scored the goals for the Premier League club. West Ham will face Eintracht Frankfurt in the semi-finals. The first-leg will take place on April 28.

101.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy is massive, getting very similar to Ashes: Lyon
101.article_body: Calling Border-Gavaskar Trophy "massive", Australia spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It's getting very similar to an Ashes series as pinnacle series for an Australian cricketer." He added, "This series with the World Test Championship on the line as well is going to be even more important and probably a bigger challenge." Since 2017, India have won three Border-Gavaskar trophies.

102.title: Bihar proposes to get 2,500-year-old wall UNESCO heritage site tag
102.article_body: According to Bihar's Art, Culture and Youth department, the state government has sent a proposal to the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to get a 2,500-year-old wall at Rajgir, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The 40 kms wall of stone was reportedly built before third century BC around the city of Rajgir to protect it from invaders.

103.title: Egypt has approved India as wheat supplier: Piyush Goyal
103.article_body: World's top wheat importer Egypt has approved India as a wheat supplier, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Friday. The development comes amid a sharp decline in availability of wheat in global markets due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, who are both major wheat exporters. Egypt is looking to import 1 million tonne of wheat from India.

104.title: Nothing will be achieved by painting JNU saffron: RJD's Manoj Jha
104.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal MP Manoj Kumar Jha condemned the 'Bhagwa JNU' posters and putting up of saffron flags outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus. He said, "What will happen if the saffron flag is planted in JNU? This is a university. Understand the university's global philosophy. Nothing will be achieved by colouring university saffron, green, red and yellow."

105.title: Sarpanch shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Baramulla
105.article_body: An independent sarpanch, identified as Manzoor Ahmad Bangroo, was shot dead by terrorists at the Goshbugh area of Baramulla district in Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Friday. "He was shifted to hospital where doctors declared him brought dead," police added. His murder was condemned by L-G Manoj Sinha who said, "Perpetrators of this despicable act shall be punished."

106.title: Russia says it hit Ukrainian arms factory after sinking of Russian ship
106.article_body: Russia on Friday said its forces had struck a factory in Kyiv that made and repaired Ukrainian missiles. The attack comes after Ukraine claimed its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, Moskva, this week. However, Russia did not confirm that Ukrainian missile strikes had hit the ship.

107.title: KKR's Nitish Rana smashes SRH's fridge with a 69-metre six, video goes viral
107.article_body: KKR batter Nitish Rana smashed a six on the bowling of SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, in the 13th over, which went on to smash the fridge in the SRH dugout. The distance recorded for the maximum was 69 metres. Rana scored 54 runs off 36 deliveries in the innings. It was his 14th fifty in IPL.

108.title: Amber Heard once spit in my face when I asked for higher salary, claims former assistant
108.article_body: A former personal assistant to Amber Heard said the actress once spit in her face when she asked for a higher salary. Kate James said she was paid "very poorly" and that she was hired at an initial salary of $25 an hour. She added she never saw Heard suffer any physical abuse at the hands of then-husband Johnny Depp.

109.title: K'taka minister, booked for contractor's alleged suicide, resigns
109.article_body: Days after he was booked for a contractor's alleged suicide, BJP leader and Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa handed over his resignation to CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Friday. He said he was resigning "to prevent embarrassment to the BJP". The deceased contractor, Santhosh Patil, claimed Eshwarappa and his aides demanded a 40% commission to clear his nearly ₹4 crore bill.

110.title: He takes brave decisions for GT: Rashid on Hardik's captaincy
110.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan has praised Hardik Pandya for keeping the team environment "amazing" under him, saying the captain always takes the "brave" decisions. "He's someone who is very clear in mind on what he is going to do...he has been delivering the best so far and leading from the front– (be it) batting, bowling and fielding," he added.

111.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Carreno Busta to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
111.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Thursday defeated Pablo Carreno Busta 6-2, 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "To win the biggest tournaments in the world, like Masters series, like Grand Slams, you have to be aggressive," the 24-year-old German said. Zverev reached the quarter-finals in Monte Carlo for the second time.

112.title: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
112.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.

113.title: BJP govt did more work for STs than Oppn did in 6 decades: Bhatia
113.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Friday said the BJP government did more work for Scheduled Tribes than what the Opposition did during their nearly six-decade-long rule. Bhatia said, "PM Modi emphasised on Eklavya Model Residential School for better education of children of SC/ST society." Under the scheme, 452 new schools will be built in the next five years, Bhatia added.

114.title: Konkani should also be used in Bombay HC proceedings in Goa: CM
114.article_body: The Goa government has decided to write to the Bombay High Court seeking to list the Konkani language, in addition to English, to conduct all the court proceedings in Goa. Goa CM Pramod Sawant said, "It will be our endeavour to ensure that the court should function in English as well as in Konkani."

115.title: Respect him for this: BJP's Locket on TMC leader's 'woman CM' remark
115.article_body: Commenting on TMC leader Saugata Roy's "woman CM" remark, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee on Friday said she respects him for this statement. She added, "This is exactly what we were saying. Other TMC members should also speak...truth." Roy had said it's a "matter of shame" if crimes against women take place in a state where a woman is the CM.

116.title: It wasn't bird poop that fell on Biden, it was corn: White House on video
116.article_body: White House Communications Director Kate Bedingfield has issued a clarification after a video appeared to show that bird poop fell on US President Joe Biden's suit during his speech in Iowa recently. "If you guys knew your way around a corn silo at all, you'd know it was corn," she tweeted while sharing the video.

117.title: PM Modi greets people of Himachal Pradesh on its statehood day
117.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today greeted Himachal Pradesh's people on its statehood day. He said the state has converted challenges into opportunities, reiterating the commitment to take development to every inhabitant of Himachal during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'. He added the state has to be developed at a quick pace to take it ahead in fields like tourism and higher education.

118.title: N Chandrasekaran implements management reshuffle at Air India
118.article_body: After the recent acquisition of Air India by Tata Group, Air India and Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has conducted a major reshuffle in the airline's senior management. Veteran Meenakshi Mallik has been replaced by Nipun Aggarwal as the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and Suresh Dutt Tripathi will succeed Air India's Amrita Sharan as the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO).

119.title: Nepal's foreign exchange reserves are running low: Official
119.article_body: Nepal's foreign exchange reserves are running low and will run out in seven months if things don't improve, a spokesperson for the Central Bank of Nepal said on Friday. The reserves are needed to import medicines, oil products, cars and a range of other items in the Himalayan nation. Currently, Nepal's government has restricted imports of non-essential goods.

120.title: We're going to see him back on court again: Roddick on Federer
120.article_body: After Roger Federer shared pictures of himself training in gym as he continues his knee rehabilitation, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said everyone is going to see the 20-time Grand Slam champion back on court again. "He wouldn't post something like this unless he's confident in his recovery," he stated. Federer had a third right knee surgery in August 2021.

121.title: Fans organise Alia-Ranbir's 'Bengali wedding' in Kolkata, pics viral
121.article_body: Fans of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor organised a 'Bengali wedding' for the couple in Kolkata using cutouts of their faces on life-size dolls. The bride and groom dolls arrived at a special ceremony at Ballygunge 21 Pally cultural club on hand-pulled rickshaws. Pictures from the ceremony have gone viral on social media. Alia and Ranbir got married on Thursday.

122.title: It was a proud moment for me, my family: GT pacer Dayal on his IPL debut
122.article_body: Speaking about his IPL debut against RR in ongoing tournament, GT pacer Yash Dayal said it was a "proud moment" for him and his family. "It's a big thing for me for the kind of background I come from...I was a bit nervous but I controlled it," he added. The 24-year-old posted bowling figures of 4-0-40-3 in the match.

123.title: RSS should merge with BJP and become political party: Rajasthan CM
123.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) should merge with BJP and become a political party. He added that "RSS works to make BJP win by staying behind" and they should now come forward. Gehlot's comments come after RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that 'Akhand Bharat' will become a reality in 15 years.

124.title: India will talk non-violence but also carry a stick: RSS chief Bhagwat
124.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, while addressing a gathering of saints in Haridwar on Wednesday, said India will talk about non-violence but will also carry the stick as "the world only understands power". He further said that India's journey of progress has begun and "those who want to stop it will be either removed or finished, but India will not stop".

125.title: 6 killed after jeep crashes into truck on Rajasthan highway
125.article_body: Six members of a family were killed after a jeep carrying nine people crashed into a truck on the Jaipur-Jodhpur national highway on Thursday. According to police, the jeep got stuck in the truck after the collision resulting in the death of three people on the spot. The other three died in hospital while the injured were shifted to Jodhpur.

126.title: Ranbir pays tribute to Rishi, wears his watch worth ₹21 lakh on wedding
126.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor paid a tribute to his father late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor at his wedding with actress Alia Bhatt by wearing his watch worth ₹21 lakh. The watch reportedly comes with an 18 karat white gold case with a blue alligator leather strap. The couple got married on April 14 in an intimate ceremony at Ranbir's Vastu residence.

127.title: England Women pacer Anya Shrubsole retires from international cricket aged 30
127.article_body: England's 2017 Women's World Cup-winning pacer Anya Shrubsole announced her retirement from international cricket aged 30. "I feel immensely privileged to have been able to represent my country for the past 14 years," she said. Shrubsole bagged nine wickets in the 2022 Women's World Cup. Notably, she was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in the 2017 Women's World Cup final.

128.title: Pregnant Rihanna breaks up with boyfriend A$AP Rocky after he cheats on her: Report
128.article_body: Rihanna's fans have reacted amid claims that she was cheated on by boyfriend A$AP Rocky, with whom she's expecting her first child. A fashion influencer tweeted that they broke up after she found him cheating on her with Amina Muaddi, who's currently employed at Rihanna's clothing line Fenty. "Cheating on a woman pregnant with your child is...inhumane," a person wrote.

129.title: Musk can buy Sri Lanka, call himself Ceylon: Snapdeal CEO shares viral text
129.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to share a viral WhatsApp forward after Elon Musk offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion. "He can buy [Sri Lanka's debt] and call himself Ceylon Musk," Bahl said. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s and recently declared it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.

130.title: If harmed, India won't spare anyone: Defence Minister on standoff with China
130.article_body: While speaking about Ladakh standoff with China in US, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "I cannot say openly what they (Indian soldiers) did...But I can definitely say that a message has gone that India will not spare anyone if harmed." India believes in having a bilateral relationship which is based on win-win for both the countries, he added.

131.title: Senco Gold files draft papers for ₹525 crore IPO
131.article_body: Jewellery retailer Senco Gold and Diamonds has filed draft papers with the SEBI to raise ₹525 crore through an IPO. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares of up to ₹325 crore and an offer for sale of shares worth ₹200 crore. Senco plans to use net proceeds from IPO towards funding working capital requirements and general corporate purposes.

132.title: I cried a lot, baby is only 12 days old: Bharti Singh on returning to work
132.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh posed for journalists as she returned to work on Friday. In a video shared by a journalist account, she can be heard saying that she cried a lot and her baby is only 12 days old. "Lekin kaam kaam hai (But work is work)," she added. Bharti and husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcomed a son on April 3.

133.title: SRH to bowl first against KKR, Ajinkya Rahane dropped by KKR
133.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against KKR in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. KKR have made three changes to their playing XI, with Aaron Finch, Aman Khan and Sheldon Jackson replacing Ajinkya Rahane, Rasikh Salam and Sam Billings. Rahane has been dropped after scoring 80 runs in five innings.

134.title: Wave of inclusivity in H'wood shouldn't be taken for granted: Regina
134.article_body: Actress Regina Hall has stated that the wave of inclusivity in Hollywood shouldn't be taken for granted, adding there will always be room for change and inclusivity and it will always remain a work in progress. "Look at what (writer-director) Mariama Diallo did with...'Master'...[touching] upon the issue of race, gender...Having a film like that is evidence of change," Regina said.

135.title: Hyd Police officers help family change punctured car tyres at 1 am
135.article_body: Two Hyderabad Police officers on patrol in the city's Ambedkar Nagar area on Thursday helped a stranded family, after spotting them stuck in their car due to punctured tyres at around 1 am. "Mr Rajesh and Mr Narender not only checked...safety of my family but also lent...helping hand in changing tyres," wrote Sunil Jain, the person who was stuck.

136.title: Bulldozers raze riots-accused's properties in Guj's Khambhat
136.article_body: The Gujarat government on Friday used bulldozers to raze properties allegedly belonging to those accused of violence on Ram Navami in Khambhat, a video of which has surfaced. "We have been given directions by DM and SP to remove unauthorised structures that are causing hurdles in the commute of people to maintain a peaceful environment," SDM Khambhat Nirupa Gadhvi said.

137.title: MMRDA to set up museum dedicated to Mumbai Trans-Harbour Link
137.article_body: The MMRDA will set up a museum dedicated to the Mumbai Trans-Harbour Link, one of the longest sea bridges in the country. The museum will showcase the construction timeline, obstacles, technology, and engineering method used in an audiovisual format. The 21.8-km-long sea link that'll connect South Mumbai with Navi Mumbai is being built at an estimated cost of ₹18,000 crore.

138.title: Ram wasn't God, Tulsidas-Valmiki created this character: Ex-Bihar CM
138.article_body: Former Bihar CM and Hindustan Awam Morcha chief has said Ram wasn't a God but a character created by  Tulsidas-Valmiki. "They created 'kavya' and 'mahakavya' with this character...It states a lot of good things and we revere that...I revere Tulsidas-Valmiki but not Ram," he added. Manjhi claimed there are only two castes in the world - rich and poor.

139.title: Video shows huge crowd as chariot festival begins in Madurai
139.article_body: The annual chariot festival pulled up a huge crowd in Madurai, Tamil Nadu near the Meenakshi Amman Temple. In a video, thousands of devotees can be seen around the temple. The festival, which is celebrated during the Tamil month of Chithirai, was not observed for the last two years due to coronavirus pandemic.

140.title: 235 electricity feeders under load shedding in Pune district
140.article_body: At least 235 electricity feeders in the Pune district are under load shedding, according to a report. "Currently, load shedding is in a few parts of Manchar and Rajgurunagar. Load shedding is taking place along the power line where people haven't paid their bills," an official said. Notably, the government has imposed load shedding in several parts of the state.

141.title: 2 women prisoners get pregnant after having sex with transgender inmate in US jail
141.article_body: Two inmates serving time in a women-only prison in US' New Jersey got pregnant allegedly after having consensual sex with a transgender inmate. The state Department of Corrections has said that the women had consensual sexual relationships with another incarcerated person. Meanwhile, 27-year-old transgender prisoner Demitrius Minor has claimed online that he got the two women pregnant.

142.title: Mama will rebuild the houses burnt in Khargone violence: MP CM
142.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured action against Khargone violence culprits and said that those whose houses were burnt in the violence, need not worry. He said, "Their Mama will re-build their houses." On April 10, during Ram Navami procession, clashes broke out, where several houses and vehicles were set on fire.

143.title: Don't fall into BJP's trap, vote for AAP in Himachal polls: Sisodia
143.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has urged residents of Himachal Pradesh to vote for the AAP in the upcoming state Assembly elections, cautioning them against falling into the BJP's trap. Sisodia accused the BJP of announcing freebies out of the fear of losing the state polls. "BJP has never believed in...concept of providing things to people at...cheaper rate," he added.

144.title: World War 3 has now begun, says Russian state TV
144.article_body: World War 3 has already started, said Russia's state TV following the sinking of the Russian warship Moskva. Olga Skabeyeva told Rossiya 1 channel viewers that "what it's escalated into can safely be called World War 3" and insisted "that's entirely for sure". "Now we're definitely fighting against NATO infrastructure, if not NATO itself," she added.

145.title: KKR's Umesh has everything in his arsenal right now: Irfan Pathan
145.article_body: Talking about Umesh Yadav, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said the KKR pacer has everything in his arsenal currently. "He's bowling outswing...brilliant inswingers and his rhythm is perfect...he's putting up a show in this season for KKR who showed faith in him," he added. Umesh, with 10 wickets from five matches, is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 so far.

146.title: Anil thanks Delhi Police for catching thieves who stole from Sonam's Delhi home
146.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Friday thanked Delhi Police for catching the culprits who stole from his daughter actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband Anand Ahuja's Delhi residence. He wrote on Twitter, "Shoutout to @DelhiPolice for their diligence and hard work at solving crimes in the city. Grateful for their service in solving the robbery case at Ahuja home so promptly."

147.title: Hyd Police issues traffic advisory over Hanuman Jayanthi on Saturday
147.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday announced traffic diversions in the city for Saturday due to 'Hanuman Jayanthi Vijaya Yathra'. The main procession will start at 11.30 am from the Gowliguda Ram temple and proceed towards the Tadbund Hanuman temple. The procession will cover a 12-km distance and is expected to conclude at about 8 pm.

148.title: SDPI worker killed in front of father in Kerala, party blames BJP-RSS
148.article_body: A 44-year-old worker of SDPI, the political wing of PFI, was allegedly killed in front of his father in Kerala's Palakkad district on Friday. The deceased, Subair, was returning from Friday prayers with his father when a car hit their bike. A four-member gang emerged from another car and attacked him. The party has blamed BJP-RSS for his death.

149.title: He still is game's best role model: Vaughan after Root quit Test captaincy
149.article_body: After Joe Root stepped down as England's Test captain, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "Root gave it everything with very little support for...red ball team under his watch." He added, "He still is and will (be)...game's best role model for many many years...now enjoy being the senior player for many more seasons." With 27 wins, Root is England's most successful Test captain.

150.title: Jasprit Bumrah is the best cricketer in Asia currently: Mohammad Kaif
150.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif named pacer Jasprit Bumrah as the best player currently in Asia, terming him as a "very cool" and composed player who delivers under pressure. "People talk a lot about batters from Virat Kohli to MS Dhoni," said Kaif. Kaif added that Pakistan captain Babar Azam does not get enough appreciation for his performances.

151.title: Home isolation COVID-19 cases rise by 48% in 1 week in Delhi
151.article_body: There has been a nearly 48% increase in home isolation COVID-19 cases in one week in Delhi, official data suggests. On April 8, 388 patients were in home isolation and on April 14, 574 patients were in home isolation. After Delhi reported 325 new cases on Thursday, the active COVID-19 cases in the city rose to 915.

152.title: Woman beats up Swiggy delivery boy with shoes on a busy road in MP; video viral
152.article_body: A video showing a woman beating up a Swiggy delivery boy with shoes on a busy road in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur is going viral on social media. The incident reportedly took place after the bike of the delivery agent, who was coming from the wrong side, collided with her scooty. "I have been injured," the woman said in the video.

153.title: Alia wanted her kaleeras small, delicate: Designer Mrinalini Chandra
153.article_body: Designer Mrinalini Chandra has revealed that actress Alia Bhatt wanted her bespoke wedding kaleeras small and delicate. "You can't tell what's going on...It is for them to know. They want the people to keep guessing...It reflects their personality," she added. Alia got married to Ranbir Kapoor on Thursday at his Vastu residence. Her kaleeras and mangalsutra featured the infinity symbol.

154.title: Incredible how SRH read games, they've used resources better than KKR: Ojha
154.article_body: Discussing the upcoming match between SRH and KKR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said SRH have utilised their resources better than KKR, adding that the way they read games is pretty incredible. SRH are currently on the eighth spot on the IPL 2022 points table, while KKR are second. "This is going to be a good competition," added Ojha.

155.title: Really surprised to see MI not showing faith in ₹8.25-cr buy David: Jaffer
155.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he is "really surprised" to see Mumbai Indians (MI) not showing faith in all-rounder Tim David, who was bought for ₹8.25 crore in IPL mega auction. "Surely he's good enough to play more than a couple of games," Jaffer added. David has scored 13 runs in two IPL 2022 matches.

156.title: Barcelona crash out of Europa League after losing to Eintracht Frankfurt
156.article_body: Barcelona have been knocked out of Europa League after losing the quarter-final 3-4 on aggregate against Eintracht Frankfurt. After the first leg ended in a 1-1 draw, Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Barcelona 3-2 in the second leg at Camp Nou. Eintracht Frankfurt scored their three goals in the second leg before Barcelona could even open their account.

157.title: First COVID-19 case of IPL 2022 confirmed as DC physio Patrick Farhart tests positive
157.article_body: The first COVID-19 case of IPL 2022 has been confirmed as Delhi Capitals (DC) physio Patrick Farhart tested positive for the virus. The IPL said in a statement that the Australian is being closely monitored by the DC medical team at the moment. DC are scheduled to face RCB on Saturday.

158.title: Lewandowski 'definitely' staying at Bayern Munich next season: CEO Kahn
158.article_body: Bayern Munich CEO Oliver Kahn said striker Robert Lewandowski will "definitely" be staying at the club next season. "We would be stupid to sell a player who scores 30 to 40 goals per season," Kahn said. Lewandowski's contract with Bayern Munich expires next summer. Lewandowski has won the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich five times so far.

159.title: According to BJP, only Hindus were harmed in Karauli violence: Owaisi
159.article_body: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi has alleged that "according to the BJP, only Hindus were harmed" in the communal clashes which took place in Rajasthan's Karauli. "A minister of Rajasthan government said that a total of 80 shops were burnt in Karauli, out of which 73 belonged to Muslims," Owaisi said. He further alleged that Muslims were targeted by "Sangh rioters".

160.title: I'll come out innocent, will become minister again: KS Eshwarappa
160.article_body: Karnataka Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj KS Eshwarappa, who is slated to resign today after his name figured in a contractor's alleged suicide case, has said he'll be proven innocent and will become a minister again. "If I continue as a minister when the investigation is on, there'll be a feeling that I may influence it," he said.

161.title: Dimitrov beats world no. 7 Ruud to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
161.article_body: Grigor Dimitrov on Thursday beat world number seven Casper Ruud 6-3, 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "I just played and enjoyed the game," Dimitrov said after winning in one hour and 31 minutes. Dimitrov, in his ninth appearance at the tournament, last reached the semi-finals in Monte Carlo in 2018.

162.title: Earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hits Odisha's Ganjam
162.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 3.5 on the Richter scale hit Odisha's Ganjam district at 11:19 am on Friday, an official of the Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre confirmed. The epicentre of the earthquake was 203 km south of Rourkela. Its depth was 10 km inside the earth's crust. No casualty or major damage has been reported.

163.title: KKR will have to remove Rahane as well if they drop Billings: Parthiv
163.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said that KKR will have to remove Ajinkya Rahane as well if they drop Sam Billings from the lineup, to bring in a wicketkeeper. Rahane has scored 80 runs in five IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 100. Meanwhile, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha stated that KKR will stick with Rahane who is experienced.

164.title: Ukraine to face Scotland in World Cup qualifying play-off SF on June 1
164.article_body: UEFA and FIFA on Thursday said in a statement that Ukraine's World Cup qualifying play-off semi-final against Scotland has been rearranged for June 1. The match was initially due to be played on March 24 but was postponed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The winner between Ukraine and Scotland will face Wales in the play-off final on June 5.

165.title: Over 27.5 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
165.article_body: More than 27,57,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Friday. Around 26,800 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Thursday. Reportedly, the number of people crossing the border into Poland has fallen significantly in recent weeks and numbers going into Ukraine have risen.

166.title: Cyrus Sahukar to tie the knot, shares videos from pre-wedding festivities
166.article_body: VJ-actor Cyrus Sahukar and his longtime girlfriend, actress Vaishali Malahara are all set to get married in Alibaug. According to reports, the couple celebrated their mehendi function on Thursday. He took to his Instagram Stories to share some videos and pictures of the pre-wedding festivities, where he can be seen posing with Mini Mathur, Kabir Khan and Samir Kochhar.

167.title: Actress Pooja Hegde joins 'F3' shoot for a special song
167.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde has joined Telugu film 'F3: Fun and Frustration' for a special dance number. Taking to Twitter, director Anil Ravipudi shared a picture of the actress from the back. Starring Venkatesh Daggubati and Varun Tej in the lead roles, 'F3' is bankrolled by Sri Venkateswara Creations. It will release in theatres on May 27.

168.title: Jesus Christ's ideals are guiding light for people: PM on Good Friday
168.article_body: On the occasion of Good Friday, PM Narendra Modi remembered the sacrifices of Jesus Christ. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "We remember the courage and sacrifices of Jesus Christ today on Good Friday...His ideals of service and brotherhood are...guiding light for several people." Notably, Good Friday is a Christian religious holiday commemorating the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ.

169.title: Musk offered to buy my firm too: Journalist while sharing his experience
169.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, journalist Conrad Quilty-Harper spoke about the time when Musk offered to buy the science magazine he worked for in 2019. While Musk didn’t acquire the company, Conrad shared aspects such as trusting your social media manager, auditing the Twitter following and interaction with Musk, etc, as the takeaways from the incident.

170.title: Mamata can't question character of victim: WB BJP chief on Nadia rape case
170.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar criticised CM Mamata Banerjee for her "rape or love affair" remark on the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia district and said, "Case should be registered against the CM." "She (Mamata Banerjee) can't question the character of the victim," he added. Her comments have "ashamed the Bengali community", he further said.

171.title: Patient attacks doctor with scissors in ICU of Delhi hospital: Police
171.article_body: A 40-year-old patient attacked a doctor with a pair of scissors in a Delhi hospital on Friday, police said. The incident occurred when the doctor came into the ICU to treat the patient, who was hospitalised to get rid of alcohol addiction and occasional fits, according to police. The doctor reportedly suffered minor injuries in his hand during the incident.

172.title: 38-yr-old climber dies on Mt Everest, was found in a sitting position
172.article_body: Ngimi Tenji Sherpa, a 38-year-old Nepali climber who summited Mount Everest several times, has died on the peak, expedition organisers said. He was carrying equipment uphill to Camp 2 and was found in a sitting position, still wearing his backpack. "His body has been brought down. There were no accidents, and initial medical check suggests high-altitude sickness," an official said.

173.title: Shot in real cockpit, was tough to shoot in confined space: Rakul on Runway 34
173.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, who'll be seen alongside Ajay Devgn in the film 'Runway 34', has revealed that they shot for the film in a real cockpit. "We got a real simulator...every button that you see is real. So whatever we were pressing was real," she added. Rakul further said it was tough to shoot in a confined space.

174.title: Wrestling is our oldest sport, not including it in CWG 2026 is wrong: Bajrang
174.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has criticised the decision of dropping wrestling from the initial sports programme list for the Commonwealth Games 2026. "The Commonwealth Games Federation will decide but the decision...is wrong to keep wrestling, shooting and archery out. Wrestling is our oldest sport in the Games and keeping it out is not right," said the 28-year-old wrestler.

175.title: He's one of the best batters in IPL: GT pacer Ferguson on Buttler
175.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler, GT pacer Lockie Ferguson said the RR opener is one of the best batters in IPL. "The way he was batting (against GT), there's not a lot you can do when a guy's batting that well," he added. Ferguson bowled a yorker to dismiss Buttler (54) in GT's 37-run win against RR in IPL 2022.

176.title: My conclusion, Musk is f****** with SEC: Cuban on his Twitter bid
176.article_body: US billionaire investor Mark Cuban while discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter bid, said, "My conclusion, Elon Musk is f****** with...SEC."
