The convict, Sajan, was caught by the police after they spotted him trying to evade detection at a check post in May 2019. Upon checking, they had recovered the drug from a polybag that he was carrying.

352.title: Punjab man stalks & assaults woman, steals her undergarments; booked
352.article_body: A 58-year-old man in Punjab's Machipur has been booked for allegedly assaulting a 47-year-old woman since 2005. The woman claimed that the accused trespassed into her house and stole her undergarments. He also urinated in front of her, making obscene gestures in public, she claimed. She alleged he assaulted her and tore her shirt at a school where she works.

353.title: Apple testing 9 new Macs with 4 different M2 chip variants: Report
353.article_body: Apple has started testing several new Mac models with the next-generation M2 chips, Bloomberg News reported citing sources. It's testing at least nine Mac models with four different M2-based chips with third-party apps in its App store. It's also testing a Mac mini with an M1 Pro chip, the same processor used in the entry-level 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pros.

354.title: Heavy rain causes waterlogging in B'luru; 1 electrocuted to death
354.article_body: A 21-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Bengaluru as heavy rainfall caused waterlogging in the city on Thursday. The man was reportedly electrocuted when he came in close contact with a cut wire, however, BESCOM claimed they'd cut the power in the area. The BBMP also said that about 12 trees had been uprooted due to the wind speed.

355.title: Auto driver booked for pelting stones at BEST bus driver in Mumbai
355.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked by police for injuring a BEST bus driver by throwing stones at him in Mumbai. According to police, the incident occurred on Wednesday night when BEST bus driver, Kailash Daatkhile, had to apply emergency brakes after an auto stopped suddenly. Daatkhile allegedly shouted at the auto driver who then pelted stones in retaliation.

356.title: Upgraded AC local trains to be introduced by 2023 in Mumbai: Report
356.article_body: The new AC local trains with upgraded seating arrangements and increased space are expected to be introduced on Mumbai's railway tracks by 2023, reported HT. The trains will have metro-like interiors with longitude seatings and additional space for passengers to travel inside the train, the report said. The upgraded AC locals will have separate luggage compartments, the report added.

357.title: 75-year-old man stabbed to death at his home in Gurugram's Sector 69
357.article_body: A 75-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death at his four-storey residence in Gurugram's Sector 69 on Wednesday, police said. The deceased was stabbed at least six times in the neck with a sharp weapon used for breaking ice slabs, police added. The suspects allegedly rang the doorbell of the deceased's flat after climbing to the third floor, police stated.

358.title: Thieves bought second-hand car, cleared debts with loot from Sonam's house
358.article_body: The nurse and her husband, who were arrested for a theft of cash and jewellery worth ₹2.4 crore from the residence of Sonam Kapoor's in-laws, used the money to pay off their debt, cover their parents' treatment costs and bought a second-hand car. The police said the nurse would steal valuables from the room after giving sedatives to Sonam's mother-in-law.

359.title: Sex racket busted at Pune spa; 6 including 4 women from Thailand rescued
359.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a sex racket operating from a spa centre in Aundh and has rescued six women, including four from Thailand. The manager of the spa has been arrested, police said, adding that two other persons have been booked for allegedly running the sex racket. "Visa details of the four women are being probed," an officer said.

360.title: 4 including 2 women held for running prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai
360.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai's Vashi area. According to police, the accused used to lure customers over the phone and meet them at designated places. Vashi police then laid a trap by sending dummy customers and caught the accused near a lodge in Juhu Gaon.

361.title: 55 homes of man who says Putin is godfather to his daughter seized by Ukraine
361.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Thursday said they have seized 154 assets belonging to pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk. The assets include 23 houses, 32 apartments, 30 plots of land, 26 cars, and one yacht, The Washington Post reported. Medvedchuk, who says Russian President Vladimir Putin is godfather to his daughter, was arrested earlier this week.

362.title: Jonty Rhodes touches Sachin Tendulkar's feet after IPL match, video goes viral
362.article_body: A video went viral on social media showing Punjab Kings (PBKS) assistant coach Jonty Rhodes touching Mumbai Indians (MI) mentor Sachin Tendulkar's feet following the IPL 2022 match between MI and PBKS. Sachin was seen trying to stop Rhodes from touching his feet while the teams were greeting each other. "Watch IPL just for moments like these," a fan tweeted.

363.title: Those b*******: Musk on SEC over his 2018 Tesla tweets settlement
363.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while discussing his SEC settlement over his 2018 Tesla tweets said, "I was forced to concede to the SEC unlawfully. Those b*******." He added he was forced to settle as banks threatened to cease providing capital and Tesla could have gone bankrupt. "I was forced to admit that I lied to save Tesla's life," Musk said.

364.title: 14-yr-old boy rapes 13-yr-old girl, threatens with scissors in Pune
364.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been booked for allegedly threatening a 13-year-old girl with scissors and then raping her in Pune. The incident had occurred on April 3 when the accused forcibly entered the house while the girl was alone, the girl's father claimed in the complaint. The accused had reportedly also threatened to kill the girl's parents.

365.title: Hardik Pandya apologises to Prasidh Krishna after edging ball to four, video goes viral
365.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya was seen apologising to Rajasthan Royals (RR) fast bowler Prasidh Krishna after scoring a boundary through a thick outside edge on the last delivery of their innings. Prasidh was seen smiling after Hardik apologised. Hardik scored 87*(52) as his team defeated RR by 37 runs.

366.title: Not sure if I'll be able to acquire Twitter, have a Plan B too: Musk
366.article_body: After making an offer to acquire Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he wasn’t sure if he'll be "actually able to acquire it." Speaking at a TED event, Musk also said he has a Plan B if Twitter rejected his offer. He said his offer was to create "an inclusive arena for free speech" and not to make money.

367.title: 1 dead, 5 injured in AC compressor explosion in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
367.article_body: A man died and five others were injured after an air-conditioner compressor exploded which led to a fire at an eatery in Delhi's Jamia Nagar on Thursday, police said. Earlier, officials said 13 people were injured following a cylinder blast, however, police later confirmed it was an AC compressor explosion. The fire was extinguished within an hour, an official added.

368.title: Russian warship sinks after being hit by Ukrainian missile
368.article_body: Russia has said its warship Moskva sank on Thursday after an explosion and fire that Ukraine claimed was caused by a missile strike. The warship sank as it was being towed to port in stormy weather, Russian news agencies quoted the defence ministry as saying. Ukraine said it hit the warship with a Ukrainian-made Neptune anti-ship missile.

369.title: Mumbai man complains about people playing cricket till 2:30 am, police respond
369.article_body: A Twitter user, while tagging Mumbai police in his tweet, complained of disturbance being caused due to people playing cricket at night. "Night cricket...has become nuisance...Is it legal? They play till 2.30 am...and [are] very noisy...It disturbs our sleep...not to mention we have senior citizens in building," he wrote. Mumbai police said they have informed main control room about issue.

370.title: Mumbai man kills 17-year-old female friend in hotel, later dies by suicide
370.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 17-year-old female friend in a hotel and then killed himself by jumping in front of a running train in Mumbai. Police said the duo was in a relationship and the girl had sent some intimate pictures of herself to him. The man allegedly demanded money from her and threatened to post her pictures online.

371.title: Twitter not held hostage by Musk's offer, CEO Parag tells staff: Report
371.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, while reassuring the staff, said that they weren't being "held hostage" by the news of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy the company, a source told Reuters. Agrawal also encouraged employees to remain focused and said that "we as employees control what happens". On Thursday, Musk offered to acquire Twitter for $43 billion.

372.title: Jumped in river but couldn't find them: Uncle of boys who drowned in Delhi
372.article_body: Omar Shahid, uncle of Sahil and Mohd Ali who along with their two friends drowned in the Yamuna while playing in Delhi's Kalindi Kunj area, said he found the boys' clothes on the riverbank. "I jumped into the river but couldn't find them...I got scared and called police," Shahid said. Police said three out of four bodies have been recovered.

373.title: GT defeat RR to jump to top of points table, record their highest total in IPL 2022
373.article_body: GT defeated RR by 37 runs to register their fourth win and jump to the top of IPL 2022 points table. GT put up a total of 192/4, their highest total in IPL 2022 so far. GT captain Hardik Pandya top-scored with 87*(52). GT pacers Lockie Ferguson and Yash Dayal took three wickets each as RR were restricted to 155/9.

374.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths drop for 3rd straight week: WHO
374.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths dropped for a third consecutive week. WHO said between April 4 to 10 over seven million cases and over 22,000 deaths were reported across the six WHO regions, representing a 24% drop in cases and 18% drop in deaths compared to the previous week.

375.title: We know that the season has only just begun: Ferrari President Elkann
375.article_body: Ferrari President John Elkann said Ferrari understands that "the season has only just begun" after winning two out of the three races so far this season. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won in Bahrain and Australia while finishing second in Saudi Arabia. "Like all our fans around the world, I am happy to be back competing at the highest level," Elkann said.

376.title: Russia trying to recruit our citizens to fight in Ukraine: Moldova
376.article_body: Moldova on Thursday accused Russia of trying to recruit its citizens from the country's breakaway region of Transdniestria to fight in Ukraine. This comes days after British military intelligence made similar claims, adding that Russia wants to boost its troop buildup in Ukraine. Located in eastern Moldova, Transdniestria is a narrow strip of land controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

377.title: India's Pujara, Pakistan's Rizwan make their Sussex debut together, club shares pic
377.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara and Pakistani wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan made their debut for county cricket club Sussex today. Sussex took to Twitter to share a picture of Pujara and Rizwan posing together wearing their debut caps ahead of their match against Derbyshire. "What an amazing picture," a fan commented on the picture.

378.title: Have gained a wonderful son: Alia's mother Soni Razdan on Ranbir
378.article_body: After Alia Bhatt tied the knot with Ranbir Kapoor on Thursday, Alia's mother Soni Razdan took to Instagram and congratulated the couple. "They say you lose a daughter when you gain a son. I say we gain a wonderful son, a lovely...family," Soni captioned the post. "My darling beautiful baby girl is right here with us always," she added.

379.title: World no. 5 Tsitsipas beats Djere to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
379.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas on Thursday beat Laslo Djere 7-5, 7-6(1) to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Tsitsipas has won seven ATP Tour titles so far in his career. The 23-year-old will face Argentina's Diego Schwartzman in the quarter-finals. Tsitsipas won his maiden ATP Masters 1000 title in Monte Carlo last year.

380.title: Wind & light rainfall bring relief from heat in parts of Delhi
380.article_body: Residents got a brief relief from the scorching heat on Thursday evening as gusty winds and very light rainfall were reported in parts of Delhi-NCR. The maximum temperature was recorded at 39.4°C, three degrees above normal, at the Safdarjung weather observatory. At 8:30 pm, the temperature fell to 29.4°C. IMD predicted the temperature to reach around 42°C on April 18.

381.title: UK, EU impose further sanctions on 178 Russian separatists
381.article_body: The UK and EU on Wednesday imposed new sanctions on 178 Russian separatists over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "In the wake of the horrific rocket attacks on civilians in eastern Ukraine, we are today sanctioning those who prop up the illegal breakaway regions and are complicit in atrocities against the Ukrainian people," Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

382.title: Goldsmith who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home held; ₹1cr jewellery recovered
382.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested a goldsmith who purchased the stolen jewellery belonging to actress Sonam Kapoor's mother-in-law. Police said they have recovered stolen jewellery worth more than ₹1 crore that included 100 diamonds, six gold chains, diamond bangles and a diamond bracelet. The jewellery was stolen by a caregiver employed for Sonam's mother-in-law.

383.title: 4 South Korean women killed as car crashes with truck in Australia
383.article_body: Police on Thursday said four South Korean women, all aged in their 20s, were killed when their car crashed with a truck in the state of Queensland on Wednesday evening. Assistant Police Commissioner Mike Condon said one of the women failed to give way to the truck at an intersection on the highway causing the collision.

384.title: Picture of Ranbir, Alia cutting cake at their wedding surfaces online
384.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt cutting a cake at their wedding has surfaced online. This comes after Ranbir and Alia tied the knot on Thursday. In another picture, the couple could be seen drinking champagne. The duo got married after dating for five years. Karan Johar, Karisma Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor were among those who attended the wedding.

385.title: Father would be blessing PM Modi: Ex-PM's son on museum for PMs
385.article_body: Neeraj Shekhar, who is a BJP MP and son of late PM Chandra Shekhar, thanked PM Narendra Modi for the Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya, a museum dedicated to every PM of India since independence. Calling PM Modi a true statesman above party lines, Shekhar wrote, "Wherever he is, my father would be blessing PM Modi...So would all other Prime Ministers."

386.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Delbonis to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
386.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Wednesday beat Federico Delbonis 6-1, 7-5 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Monte Carlo. "This is the only Masters on clay I haven't won yet, but I'm very motivated to do so," Zverev said. The 24-year-old German has won five ATP Masters 1000 titles so far.

387.title: Delhi sees 325 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs, active cases cross 900
387.article_body: Delhi on Thursday added 325 fresh COVID-19 cases to its tally while the number of active cases was recorded at 915. No coronavirus-related deaths were registered in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate stood at 2.39%. Amid a rise in cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) will hold a meeting on April 20, an official confirmed today.

388.title: Congratulations to both of you, all the love & happiness: Katrina to Ranbir-Alia
388.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif on Thursday congratulated newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Congratulations to both of u (you)...All the love and happiness," Katrina commented on the couple's wedding pictures shared by Alia Bhatt on Instagram. "Today, surrounded by our family and friends, at home...we got married," Alia captioned her wedding pictures.

389.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats De Minaur to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
389.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev on Wednesday beat Alex de Minaur 2-6, 6-1, 6-4 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Rublev will face world number 12 Jannik Sinner for a spot in the quarter-finals. Rublev reached the final of the tournament in Monte Carlo last year where he lost to Stefanos Tsitsipas.

390.title: We must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness: CJI Ramana
390.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Friday said one must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness and only through unity can peace and progress be achieved. While visiting Amritsar's Partition Museum, Ramana said, "This museum reminds us of our tragic past and warns us against divisions of all kinds...This dark chapter in our history should serve as a lesson to mankind."

391.title: PM realising Ambedkar's dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone: Irani
391.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Thursday said that BR Ambedkar was a great national hero, adding that PM Narendra Modi is realising his dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone. She also said that the PM has taken a pledge for the betterment of society by rising above the politics of casteism and regionalism.

392.title: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tests positive for COVID-19
392.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tested positive for COVID-19 over the weekend. However, the Italian is expected to be symptom-free and available to take charge of their next Premier League match against Brighton and Hove Albion on Saturday. Tottenham beat Aston Villa 4-0 in their last game leaving them in fourth place on the Premier League table with 57 points.

393.title: Pakistan Army Chief Qamar Javed Bajwa to retire in November
393.article_body: Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff General Qamar Javed Bajwa won't seek a term extension and will retire in November this year, the country's military media wing confirmed on Thursday. The announcement comes days after reports claimed that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan had tried to dismiss Bajwa, a claim Khan has denied. Bajwa has served as Pakistan's Army Chief since 2016.

394.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
394.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.

395.title: I don't want to praise myself too much but I can be the best finisher for India: Parag
395.article_body: Talking about his aspirations, RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag said, "I don't want to praise myself too much, but I think I can be the best finisher not just for Rajasthan Royals but for India in years to come." He added, "I have got the skill-set, I've got all-rounder abilities and not just batting, fielding and bowling as well."

396.title: On the right side of history: China on its Russia stand after US' criticism
396.article_body: After US warning that China's unwillingness to sanction Russia amid war could affect its relations with other economies, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, "China is playing a constructive role in the Ukraine issue." "We oppose unfounded accusations and suspicions against China...Time will tell that China's claims are on the right side of history," Zhao added.

397.title: Bank of India files for insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
397.article_body: Bank of India on Thursday filed a petition with the National Company Law Tribunal to initiate insolvency proceedings against Future Retail for non-payment of dues. This comes amid an ongoing legal battle between Future Retail and Amazon over the former's ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries. "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us," Future Retail had said earlier.

398.title: Ukraine-returned medical students to protest in Delhi on Sunday
398.article_body: Medical students who were forced to return to Punjab from Ukraine and their parents will join a pan-India protest at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on April 17. The protest will be staged to urge the Central government for making arrangements for students to help them complete their studies in state universities in the country.

399.title: Ashamed: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Mamata's Nadia rape case remark
399.article_body: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Wednesday reacted to Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's comment on alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, stating that she's "ashamed". Paul claimed that case was handed over to CBI as Calcutta HC doesn't trust Bengal's administration. Mamata had remarked that the rape victim could have had an affair with accused or been pregnant.

400.title: Have always been selective about projects that I take on: Kareena
400.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she has always been selective about the projects she works on. "If I genuinely find a script interesting, I am immediately on board," she stated. "For me, the right project is always about the story and character and also the people who will be with me on the journey of that project," Kareena added.

401.title: WhatsApp announces new 'Communities' feature to connect multiple groups
401.article_body: WhatsApp on Thursday announced a new 'Communities' feature that will enable users to bring together separate groups under one umbrella with a structure that works for them. "People can receive updates sent to the entire Community and easily organise smaller discussion groups on what matters to them," said WhatsApp. "Communities will also contain powerful new tools for admins," added WhatsApp.

402.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
402.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.
